args:
The Speranza Opera Troupe receives a letter
from Lapis, the phantom thief, in which she
threatens to abduct their lead singer,
Belladonna. Shaken, the singer and her
director decide to seek shelter at the Halidom.
Hold my hand and I will feel no fear. ♪
Amid our restless feelings,\nthe future draws near. ♪
Anticipation covers the world in dread. ♪
I can hear the end! The end!\nTHE EEEEEEEEEEND! ♪♪♪
What a splendid opera that was!\nThe words and music were so beautiful,\nthey drew me in instantly.
We'll have to thank Lucretia for arranging\ntickets for all of us.
Guess I shouldn't be surprised the\nsongstress of the century has the\nhookup for good opera.
What's with your eyes, Elisanne?\nThey're all red.
Th-they most certainly are not,\nand I will thank you to stop looking!
It is fine that the princess's dreams of love\nwere crushed—it did not make me weep\nopenly in the slightest!
Is that actually the exact opposite\nof what you're feeling, Elly?
Aw, that's swell! Let those emotions out!
If you feel something, there's no reason\nnot to let the whole world know about it.
Thanks for bringing me along, everybody.\nThat was really something!
I thought pirates were only into jigs and\nsea shanties, not a bunch of fancy folk\nwailin' tunes at the top'a their lungs.
Yar, we pirates love all manner of song!\nThey're often the only entertainment we\nget on the high seas, after all.
Come to think of it, didn't you sing a little\nat that banquet you held on your ship?
Wait, Karina! You SING? Oh man,\nbelt me out something!
Well, I suppose one quick melody would—
A scream! I think it came from backstage!
Are you okay!? ...Wait, hold on.\nEverything seems normal here.
Uh, yeah. We heard somebody scream\nwhat to beat the band earlier and figured\nit was pirates or fiends or somesuch.
Oh, I assure you, my burly friend,\nit is far, FAR worse than that.
We've been marked by Lapis,\nthe phantom thief!
You mean to say you know nothing of the\nphantom thief Lapis?! She before whom\nthe very world trembles?!
Woah! Where was this big brute hiding?!
Oh, how very rude of me. I am Giovanni,\nthe musical director for our world-\nrenowned Speranza Opera Troupe!
I had no idea there were musical\ndragons in the world!
Dude, we LITERALLY met a dragon\nwho ran a choir, remember?
So who is this phantom thief Lapis?
She is wind and shadow! A dauntless\nand audacious thief the likes of which\nyou have never seen!

She is known as the Blue Rose. No fortress
is too secure for her, no security too tight.
What she marks, she takes—and she
announces her arrival with a calling card!
Rather odd for a thief to announce\nthemselves in advance, isn't it?
A bold strategy, if nothing else.
Could we see the card she left?
＂One week from tonight, under the full\nmoon's light, I come for the Noble Flower.\n—The Phantom Thief Lapis＂
The hell's a Noble Flower?\nSome kinda jewel?
We here at the Speranza Opera Troupe\nuse any number of precious jewels\nin our stagings...
But I know of no such jewel. Perhaps\nthis ＂Noble Flower＂ refers rather to...
You were the lead in tonight's opera,\nweren't you?
Yes. My name is Belladonna, and I'm a\nmember of the Speranza Opera Troupe.
So YOU are the Noble Flower?
Bella is our troupe's lead soloist!\nIf she were to be taken from us...
Wait. The phantom thief steals PEOPLE?
Who knows what such a despicable\ncreature is capable of?!
Why not take refuge in our castle?
Your CASTLE? Forgive my rudeness,\nbut just who ARE you people?
This is {player_name},\nthe seventh scion of Alberia.
Oh my! I am simply tickled with delight\nthat our humble opera company could\nattract such a distinguished guest!
But more to the point, is your offer\nto shelter us in earnest?
Of course. I mean, you can't very well go\nback to business as normal with this\nhanging over your heads, right?
I hate to cause you trouble, good prince...
Think nothing of it. We're not the types to\njust abandon someone in need.
In that case, I shall accept your offer.
Well, every thorn has a rose, I suppose.\nCome, children! Let's strike the set\nand make for the castle!
